Dating: LATE PERIOD (not before); GRAECO-ROMAN PERIOD (not after)
Name: Small  wadj-column
Description: This amulet takes the form of a column with a curved trunk, crowned with a capital of umbellated papyrus. It forms more specifically the hieroglyph "wadj" which refers to the stem of the papyrus, plant and symbol of Lower Egypt, and which also signifies "to be green". The use of carnelian, a red coloured stone, adds a solar connotation to the symbolic value of rebirth of this type of object.
